meanings.sent1: I was naffed when my brother ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: She naffed at the loud music coming from the neighbor's house.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked naffed when I interrupted its nap.
meanings.sent4: The teacher naffed at the students' constant chatter during the test.
meanings.sent5: The baby naffed loudly when her toy was taken away.

meanings.sent1: The naffed painting was quickly removed from the art gallery.
meanings.sent2: He refused to wear the naffed shirt his aunt gave him.
meanings.sent3: The naffed cake tasted like cardboard.
meanings.sent4: The naffed movie received terrible reviews from critics.
meanings.sent5: The naffed car broke down after just a few miles.
